results.title: The Battle against cancer
results.creator_credit: Swiss Society for Combating Cancer and American Cancer Society
results.brief_description: Prepared for lay audiences this film states that in any typical large group of Americans, one in every eight will die of cancer. To combat the high mortality caused by cancer, early treatment by X-ray, radium or surgery is essential. Microscope-slides are used in this film to show normal cell division and growth, and then the invasion of cancer cells breeding wildly.

results.title: Davis Cup, 1956
results.creator_credit: Peter Whitchurch and Ampol Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description: Edited action footage of all the matches in the 1956 David Cup Final between Australia and USA. Australia won all matches to make it its 13th Davis Cup victory and was represented by Lew Hoad and Ken Rosewall and USA by Victor Seixas, Herbert Flam and Sam Giammalva. Contains footage of historical interest including Robert Menzies in various spectator shots, Harry Hopman receiving Davis cup from Richard Nixon, then Vice President, for 1955 victory.

results.title: A Floral pageant
results.brief_description: Victoria celebrates 100 years of self government. Shots of the Royal Botanic Gardens, Government House, but mainly the procession along Elizabeth Street. Beginning title says “Presented by Ted Waterford”.

results.title: Drought feeding
results.brief_description: Discusses the various fuel values of different foodstuffs and gives much information on drought feeding of stock. Based on scientific investigations made by the Australian wool board into the subject of drought feeding of sheep, this film shows the fuel value of various types of supplementary fodder, taking into account both cost and nutritive value. The Wool Board makes available to pastoralists a Drought Feed Calculator, together with other tables relating to drought feeding, are clearly presented in this film.

results.title: Festival of the pig
results.creator_credit: J. Campbell Dobbie and Peerless Films
results.brief_description: Shows the villagers of New Guinea preparing for a feast in which pig is the chief item of food. Their elaborate costumes and a tribal dance are shown, while the sound track includes actual chants.

results.title: By Lake and Stream
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: An account of the work being done to maintain the trout population of Victorian lakes and streams. Shows the initial trapping of adult fish, stripping of eggs from the female fish, and subsequent hatching of young fry at the Snob’s Creek hatchery, keeping the young fish in brooding ponds, and finally the release of the trout to replenish lakes and streams. Various trout fishing techniques are demonstrated, and the film concludes with scenes of anglers in action in many parts of the State.

results.title: Bushfire: our summer fate
results.brief_description: Shows how a bushfire in the Blue Mountains on 6 December 1977 caused the death of one person, 70 homes to be destroyed and the evacuation of thousands all in a space of five hours and similarly how the bushfire of summer 1967 in Hobart killed 62 people and destroyed upto 1000 homes and 130 major buildings. Includes a report by scientist David Ellyards on how, where and why bushfires start in Australia followed up by how to prevent death and destruction due to bushfires.

results.title: The Blue streak rocket
results.creator_credit: George Grafton Green and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: The Blue Streak Rocket is the first stage in the development of a rocket which will help boost a one ton satellite, of the European Launcher Development Organisation, into orbit three hundred miles high. Shows the static test in England and the launching at Woomera.

results.title: Children of the Musgraves (A)
results.creator_credit: Edmee Campbell-Dobbie, J. Campbell Dobbie and Peerless Films
results.brief_description: Filmed at Ernabella Mission Station in the Musgrave Ranges, 1000 miles north of Adelaide. Shows the life of Aborigines, their schooling and play, and their assimilation to white Australian ways. They are also given time each day to follow their own cultural traditions of hunting and cooking. Narrated by J.J. Hume.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edmee Campbell-Dobbie, J. Campbell Dobbie and Peerless Films

results.title: Flame of Persia
results.brief_description: A historical, geographical and descriptive account of Persia/Iran including the celebration of 25 centuries of monarchy. Depicts the Shah of Iran discussing Persian industry and pride. Narrated by Orson Welles.
